intro: Eugenia tramnion, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and dark red berries. The plant is evergreen, with glossy, elliptical leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed soils. The fruit is edible but contains seeds that can be dispersed by birds and water, aiding in its spread.
